alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 1:27PM PST until January 30 at 8:42AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting Coos County. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, The Coquille River is at flood stage. Expect flooding of farmland and low-lying areas throughout the flood plain along the Coquille River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM PST Sunday the stage was 20.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 21.4 feet late tonight. It is forecast to fall below flood stage late Monday evening, then remain above bankfull into Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.4 feet on 02/27/1957. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 600 AM PST.
